name: rumor
content:

B2 an unofficial interesting story or piece of news that might be true or invented, and quickly spreads from person to person: Rumors are going around (the school) about Mr. Mason and his assistant. [ + that ] She's circulating/spreading rumors that the manager is going to resign. I heard a rumor that she'd been seeing Luke Harrison. rumor has it
people are saying: Rumor has it (that) you're going to be the next managing director. Is it true?
More examplesFewer examplesI heard a rumor that she's leaving, but apparently there's nothing in it.A rumor has surfaced that the company is about to go out of business.The president has consistently denied the rumors.He denied all responsibility for the rumors that have been circulating.The company moved quickly to quash rumors that it is losing money.
